project_description: A simple Flutter app that toggles text between 'Cat' and 'Dog' with corresponding icons when clicked.
architecture_overview: The project uses the Cubit pattern for state management to manage the text and icon toggle functionality. The app is highly modularized with separate folders for screens, cubits, models, and widgets.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
entity HomeScreen
entity ToggleCubit

User -> HomeScreen: Clicks ToggleText
HomeScreen -> ToggleCubit: toggleText()
ToggleCubit -> HomeScreen: emit new ToggleState
@enduml
state_management_flow: The app uses the Cubit pattern for state management. The ToggleCubit manages the state of the text and icon. When the user clicks the text, the ToggleCubit toggles the state between 'Cat' and 'Dog' with corresponding icons. The HomeScreen listens to state changes and updates the UI accordingly.
navigation_flow: The app contains a single screen (HomeScreen) which is displayed when the app is launched. There is no additional navigation.
